dashboard.label: Splunk app for Alfresco
dashboard.description: Monitoring of various Alfresco components using Splunk, JMX

ul.li: Get the latest Splunk JMX plugin here
Unpack the Splunk app for Alfresco into $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/apps (already done if you are viewing this page!)
Edit $SPLUNK_HOME/etc/apps/alfresco_app/jmxconfig/solr-config.xml and alfresco-config.xml to correctly point to your Alfresco and SOLR JVMs (providing the right JMX credentials)
Enable the Alfresco and SOLR data inputs in Settings -> Data Inputs -> JMX (Java Management Extensions)

html.p: After your Alfresco and SOLR JMX config files are set up and the data inputs are enabled, your Alfresco monitoring data is searchable. With data coming in correctly, the dashboards should also begin to display some useful info.
html.h2: Nothing shown in the index or dashboards?
html.p: Could be a JMX error, these get written to Splunk's internal index. You can also use the connectivity error dashboard built into the JMX plugin to diagnose possible JMX connection issues.
